text: what we know so far is that the airplane
took off from runway four at LaGuardia
that runway points up towards Stamford
Connecticut
made a left turn which a standard went
over the Bronx it was climbing before it
was out of the Bronx it began descending
again its maximum altitude was only a
little over 3,000 feet made a very sharp
left turn came down the Hudson and then
dropped into the Hudson River the
airplane is equipped with slides
it's equipped with flotation devices and
the reason is that about 40% of runway
ends are on water and you always worry
about an airplane going off the end of
the runway into the water this one
actually landed in water it remains to
be seen exactly how much control the
pilots had over the airplane but it
appears to have landed intact the FAA
says it has a report that everyone got
off alive but you never really know that
till later
this is Matthew Wald at the New York
Times
